step1.sentence: The company weathered the storm of the economic downturn and emerged stronger than before.

step2.story: The first year of the restaurant was brutal — wrong location, slow build, a kitchen fire in month four. But the couple refused to close, weathered the storm, and eventually found their loyal customer base in year two.

step3.story: The hospital had been underfunded and understaffed for a decade before the pandemic arrived. What followed was a period that tested every person inside it — nurses working double shifts, administrators improvising supply chains, doctors making decisions with insufficient information. The hospital weathered the storm not because it had the best resources, but because its people had built over years a culture of doing more with less and trusting each other under pressure. When the crisis eased, the hospital was recognized nationally. The staff were pleased but not surprised. They had always known what they were capable of.
